page.title: 03A STUDY OF EYE COURT FARM
page.content: {Eye Court Farm}, which is farmed by {Mr.Harry Conod}is close to the village of Eye.The farm is located on flat ground and consists of 208 acres and is a{mixed farm}concentrating on {dairying}.16 acres of the farm grows {potatoes}, 40 acres grow{wheat}and {cereal}and the remaining 152 acres are used for{hay,silage}and{grazing}for his herd of 108{friesian cattle}.They are milked twice a day producing between 1500 and 2000 litres of milk a day which is sold to the local{Cadbury factory.The markets used for selling cattle are{Leominster,Hereford}and{ {Ludlow}.Mr.Conod{employs}2 farm workers and one of these is in charge of the dairy herd.At harvest time a great deal of part time workers are also employed.As well as these workers he also has a large selection of farm {machinery}to help him on the farm.
